the state of being reversed.
an adverse change of fortune; an utter failure of one's plan or scheme.
(acting or happening) in a manner opposite or contrary to that which is usual; reversely; .
the act of giving something (as repayment of a loan amount).

a hand tool for turning screws, consisting of a handle attached to a long, narrow shank, usu. of metal, which tapers and flattens out to a tip that fits into the slot in the head of the screw; a screw driver.
a stick or a stick-like part in a machine, that rotates; a rotor.
a kind of play in which the players move in a circular, but complicatedly twisting manner, striking rhythmically, usu. to a song, the two sticks held by each of them.
to turn (something); to twist.
(fig.) to supply intentionally with false or misleading information; to misrepresent; to misstate.
the condition of being twisted in a spiral; tensional stress.
a contortion, as of the face.
a thing that is turned, twisted or rolled up.
an earthy clay of reddish brown colour, used to put a vertical sectarian mark on the fore head with.

the wheel, mounted on a vertical shaft, that rotates horizontally, used by a potter to shape clay pots, bowls, vases, etc. a potter's wheel.
a particular movement to catch the opponent in wrestling.
the basil plant, Ocimum sanctum of Lamiaceae family; Holy basil.
its leave.
the leaf of the beal tree (Aegle marmelos).
the birth day of holy, religious or venerable persons.
a sectarian mark put vertically on the forehead with a particular kind of clay of reddish brown colour.
a man (as a Śrī Vaiṣṇava, follower of Śrī Rāmānuja), who puts ತಿರುನಾಮ.
= ತಿರುನಾಳು.
a day of festival.
sacred ashes used by the Saivites for applying on the forehead, other parts of the body, as sectarian marks.

income of a temple.
a temple (in gen.).
a hill (or a range of seven hills) in Andhra Pradesh, in South India, famous centre for Hindu pilgrims.

ತಿರುಪತಿ ಆಗು tirupatiāgu (money) to be lost or spent (against one's wish); ತಿರುಪತಿ ಕ್ಷೌರ tirupati kṣaura a work done carelessly in a slipshod manner or left half-done.
